item.title: Day 2 (9th September 2021)
item.content:encoded:
Zoom link: TBA

Discord link: https://discord.gg/X7RNaUbczg

Session times

  • Day 2 Thursday 9th September 2021. 15:15-16:45 (UTC)
  • Day 2 Thursday 9th September 2021. 16:15-17:45 (GMT)

Session chairs

  • Ben Pascoe (University of Bath)
  • Evangelos Mourkas (University of Bath)
  • & Dessislava Veltcheva (University of Oxford)

Session programme

  • 00:00 Opening remarks from session chairs
  • +00:05 I1: Transcontinental adaptation of the bovine pathogen Campylobacter fetus. Daniela Costa (Institut Pasteur Montevideo)
  • +00:20 I3: Quantifying bacterial evolution in the wild: a birthday problem for Campylobacter lineages. Jessica Calland (University of Bath)
  • +00:35 I4: Campylobacter phages use hypermutable polyG tracts to create phenotypic diversity and evade bacterial resistance Martine C. H. Sørensen (University of Copenhagen, Denmark)
  • +00:50 I2: The ecology of interspecies recombination among the zoonotic bacterium Campylobacter Evangelos Mourkas (University of Bath)
  • +00:55 I5: Genomic adaptations of Campylobacter jejuni to long-term human colonisation Samuel Bloomfield (Quadram Institute Bioscience)
  • +01:00 I6: Commensalism and competition between Campylobacter jejuni strains in broiler chickens Sophie Chagneau (Research Chair in Meat Safety, Department of Pathology and Microbiology, Université de Montréal, Québec, Canada)
  • +01:05 I-P13: Occurrence, virulence potential, antimicrobial susceptibility and genetic diversity of Campylobacter spp. isolated from dogs and cats from Warsaw, Poland and the surrounding area Małgorzata Murawska (Warsaw University of Life Sciences)
  • +01:10 I-T11/T12: From wild birds to humans through surface water: a dive into Campylobacter jejuni ecology in Luxembourg Louise Hock (Luxembourg Institute of Sciences and Technology)
  • +01:15 Question and answer session regarding all talks
  • +01:30 Session summary and close (Chairs)

Timings for individual programme items are specified as an offset from when the session begins.

See Registration session for information on how to connect.

item.title: Session 1 - Host adaptation in Campylobacter
item.description: Is it the song or the singer - what shapes host adaptation in Campylobacter? Session chairs: Ben Pascoe (University of Bath), Evangelos Mourkas (University of Bath) & Dessislava Veltcheva (University of Oxford)
item.content:encoded:
Zoom link: TBA

item.title: Abstract submission now Closed!
item.description: Abstract submissions has now closed. You can still register to attend using this link: https://forms.gle/6ek3b6s6TRQHiyLw5
item.content:encoded:
Abstract submissions are now closed for CampyUK goes global 2021.

You can still register to attend using this link: https://forms.gle/6ek3b6s6TRQHiyLw5

The deadline for abstract submissions was 13th July 2021.

Abstract Submission Guidelines

Abstracts are limited to 3,000 characters. Submission should include an informative title, author list, affiliations, and abstract text.

The abstract should summarise the research in a concise and informative way, as it is the only information organisers will have when deciding what presentations will be accepted. Abstracts do not have to be structured in sections, however all abstracts should have a brief background statement summarising the basis for the work, and the aim of the work followed by methods, results and a concluding statement to bring the work into context within the research area.

You will also be able to add a brief biography about yourself (maximum 2,000 characters). You can just add links your profile on your organisation’s website if you like.
